page.title: 02COBERLEY VILLAGE AMENITIES
page.content: Coberley village is very small; it only contains 30-40 houses. It has a tiny school with only 22 pupils. The village has both gas and electricity supplies, but has no street lights. There is one telephone kiosk, used by many because 50% of the houses don't have telephones. The church has its own vicar who holds two services in a week (both on Sunday). He also looks after three other parishes. A travelling library visits the village once a week and a lot of people borrow books. There are no scouts or any other organisations. A bus stops every two hours and there is one post office which is the only shop in Coberley. There is also a spring in the village which provides fresh water.
